meanings.definition: To encircle or bind with a belt or girdle.
meanings.sent1: She decided to upgird her dress with a colorful belt.
meanings.sent2: The knight needed to upgird his sword before the battle.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer wanted to upgird the outfit with a stylish accessory.
meanings.sent4: The vines seemed to upgird the ancient ruins, holding them together.
meanings.sent5: The rope was used to upgird the treehouse, making it secure for the children.

meanings.definition: To prepare or strengthen for action or effort.
meanings.sent1: He needed to upgird himself before the important presentation.
meanings.sent2: The coach always made sure to upgird the team before a big game.
meanings.sent3: The students tried to upgird their minds for the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speech managed to upgird the spirits of the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The warm-up exercises helped to upgird her muscles for the marathon.
